comments:
Here's a snippet of WSDL:

...
<wsdl:types>
  <schema>
    <element name="bean00element">
      <xsd:simpleType>
        <xsd:list itemType="string"/>
      </xsd:simpleType>
    </element>
    ...
  </schema>
</wsdl:types>

<wsdl:message name="testMessage">
  <wsdl:part name="bean00" element="intf:bean00element"/>
  ...

Here's a snippet from a corresponding DataGraph:

(DataObject: DocumentRoot) {
    mixed=(Sequence) [
      info=(DataObject: InfoType) {
        operationName=(Data)'testOperation'
        messageName=(Data)'testOperationRequest'
        messageType=(Data)'input'
        headers=(List) []
        attachments=(List) []
        body=(DataObject: testMessage) {
          bean00=(List) [
            (Data)'David',
            (Data)'Gelder'
          ]
          ...

I can access the first item in the list with: beanGraph.getRootObject
().getString("info/body/bean00[1]");
When I attempt to access the second item with: beanGraph.getRootObject
().getString("info/body/bean00[2]");
I get the following exception:

java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index applies only to mutli-valued 
features.
  at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil$Accessor.setIndex(SDOUtil.java:844)
  at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil$Accessor.process(SDOUtil.java:893)
  at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil$Accessor.init(SDOUtil.java:718)
  at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil$Accessor.create(SDOUtil.java:638)
  at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil.get(SDOUtil.java:161)
  at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.impl.EDataObjectImpl.get
(EDataObjectImpl.java:78)
  at bean.BeanDataMediatorCoreTests.testXMLListDerivedTypes
(BeanDataMediatorCoreTests.java:1599)

(fyi: the actual type of 'bean00' is ArrayList)

Should indexing be allowed where the value is a List (or an array)?
The current situation is inconsistent.

Indexing shouldn't be allowed for single-valued features.
The fix is in CVS.

traces.message: Index applies only to mutli-valued  features.
